sentence.Network_en: It takes gumption to quit a good paying job.
sentence.Network_cn: 要辞去一个待遇很好的工作需要勇气.

sentence.Network_en: With his gumption he will make a success of himself.
sentence.Network_cn: 凭他的才干,他将大有作为.

sentence.Network_en: He suspected that deep down, she admired him for having the gumption to disagree with her.
sentence.Network_cn: 他认为，在内心深处她十分佩服他有勇气和她唱反调。

derivation.yuyuan_name: early 18th cent. (originally Scots): of unknown origin

entry.def: If someone has gumption, they are able to think what it would be sensible to do in a particular situation, and they do it.

example.ex: Surely anyone with marketing gumption should be able to sell good books at any time of year.
example.tran: 无疑，有经营头脑的人在一年的任何时节都应该能够卖掉好书。

entry.def: If someone has the gumption to do something, they are brave enough to do it.

example.ex: He suspected that deep down, she admired him for having the gumption to disagree with her.
example.tran: 他认为，在内心深处她十分佩服他有勇气和她唱反调。

sentences.sentence: "I can't see the sense in doing it now"
"he hasn't got the sense God gave little green apples"
"fortunately she had the good sense to run away"
"he didn't have the guts to try it"
